news_header: Russian attacks in Idlib, Syria result in casualties.
news_text: At least 10 people have been killed and 30 wounded in a Russian attack on Idlib, northern Syria, with 14 children among the injured, according to the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights. The Russian army, allied with Syrian President Bashar al-Assad, has not commented on the bombings. Approximately half of Idlib province is controlled by Tahrir al-Sham, and a ceasefire negotiated by Russia and Turkey has been in place since March 2020, though some restrictions remain.
